sourceMeaningMnemonic: Under this <radical>roof</radical> is a <radical>bear</radical> who works for the <kanji>government</kanji>. If you saw a bear out in the wild you might be afraid and try to run, but if you see a bear inside a building under a roof, don't be scared! It's just a government bear.
meaningInfo: Picture the government bear looking through government documents and snorting gruffly as it decides what to sign and what to reject. It has a little government sash and hat.
readingMnemonic: The first <kanji>government</kanji> that allowed bears was set up by Genghis <reading>Khan</reading> (<ja>かん</ja>). He was all about conquering people and then using them as efficiently as possible. He discovered that bears are incredibly useful in government buildings as government workers.
readingInfo: Picture Genghis Khan patting the first bear government worker on the back as they start their first day working for the government.
